   20: 
   21: -module(random_code_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   25: 
   26: -export([compile/1]).
   27: 
   28: -define(NUMTESTS, 1000).
   29: 
   30: suite() ->
   31:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   32: 
   33: all() ->
   34:     [compile].
   35: 
   36: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   37:     case ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config0) of
   38:         [_|_]=Config ->
   39:             try proper_erlang_abstract_code:module() of
   40:                 _ ->
   41:                     Config
   42:             catch
   43:                 error:undef ->
   44:                     {skip,"No proper_erlang_abstract_code module"}
   45:             end;
   46:         Other ->
   47:             Other
   48:     end.
   49: 
   50: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: compile(_Config) ->
   54:     NumTests = case os:getenv("ERL_RANDOM_CODE_NUMTESTS") of
   55:                    false ->
   56:                        ?NUMTESTS;
   57:                    NumTests0 ->
   58:                        list_to_integer(NumTests0)
   59:                end,
   60: 
   61:     %% Conservatively assume that we can run 10 tests each second.
   62:     TimeTrap = {seconds,60_000 + (NumTests+99) div 100},
   63:     ct:timetrap(TimeTrap),
   64:     io:format("~p tests\n", [NumTests]),
   65:     true = proper:quickcheck(compile_prop:compile(),
   66:                              [quiet,{numtests,NumTests}]),
   67:     ok.
